articles.title: White dwarf: Armagh astronomers say scar suggests star 'ate' planets - BBC.com
articles.description: The scar on the star was discovered by the astronomical research centre in Armagh Observatory.
articles.content:
By Rebekah WilsonBBC News NI
An artists impression of the magnetic white dwarf WD 0816-310 with a metal scar
Astronomers in Armagh have discovered a sign that a star feasted on nearby planets and a… [+2628 chars]

articles.title: Covid causes lasting damage to cognition and memory, research finds - Financial Times
articles.description: ‘Brain fog’ detectable in long and short-term cases, detailed study suggests
articles.content:
Infection with Covid-19 can cause lasting damage to cognition and memory, with brain fog detectable in long and short-term sufferers of the disease, according to new research.

articles.author: Sascha Pare
articles.title: Underwater volcano eruption 7300 years ago is the largest in recorded history - Livescience.com
articles.description: The Kikai-Akahoya eruption — the largest volcanic explosion in recorded history — ejected more than 80 cubic miles of volcanic rock and ash off the southwestern coast of Japan 7,300 years ago.
articles.content: Scientists have identified the largest volcanic eruption in recorded history — an explosion 7,300 years ago that ejected more than twice as much rock and ash as the previous record-holding eruption o… [+2948 chars]
